page.title: 17PLACE NAMES-SALPERTON AREA
page.content: Both Salperton and Hampen are mentioned in the 11th Century Domesday Book.There are two suggestions for the origin of SALPERTON.One is O.E. sealh- burna,"willow stream";the other is O.E. salt-herepae,associated with the Salt Way that passed nearby.The ending is the Old English "tun" = farmstead. At one time Salperton was called Cold Salperton and in the ecclesiastical parish records it is still known by that name.It was called "cold" because of its exposed position. Hampen, written as Hagepinne in The Domesday Book, is derived from O.E. Hagena pen = Hagena's sheep pen or enclosure.
